reviews.text: Nice boutique hotel, very nice and accommodating staff, easy to walk to downtown, discounted parking at a nearby garage, clean, simple check in and out, on the river for beautiful strolls. Would definitely recommend, much less expensive than other local hotels, room was a bit small but really doable. Lovely place altogether.

We only needed a room for one night before our flight out,and at $300, this seemed like nice accommodations and better priced than others. First the good, The staff was lovely. Very friendly, especially the bartenders at the pool bar where we had a few drinks in the evening. My issues were first, the room. It definitely didn't look like the pictures that were showed online of bright airy rooms. It was extremely small and bare, just a bed, TV and small desk, the floors were black and the walls dark green so it felt like a dungeon. Just dark and depressing. My second issue...we arrived after a long train ride and wanted coffee. During the course of the day we spent about $25 on coffee at the restaurant and bar. It wasn't until before checkout the next morning that I found a room downstairs that had a complimentary coffee machine. Maybe the staff could have mentioned that? Especially when we're sitting in the very next room paying for it??

While from the outside, this place looks nice and chic, sadly, our visit there was rather a sad affair. We stopped there on Saturday evening for a pre dinner drink, the bar was barely half full, we sat outside and although we had been seen, no one approached us for a good 20 mins. After finally ordering a cocktail and a glass of wine, we waited another 20 mins for it to be served to us, while the bar person was arranging glasses on the bar shelf. Overall, a very poor experience and I doubt we'll be back.

We stayed for two nights here on arrival in Zurich from Australia.  We had previously advised the hotel that our flight was landing early and requested an early check in.   On arrival at the hotel at 9.30am we were absolutely delighted to find that our room was ready.  The room, though small, was clean and had everything we needed.  Staff were very friendly and helpful, lent us an adaptor plug for our chargers (we have several but none that fitted the Swiss version!).    The hotel is very conveniently located - walking distance from the main station or there is a station (Selnau) within 100m of the hotel.  Great location to catch a tram or to walk into the city.   We would definitely stay here again.

Stayed for a one night transit in Zurich. Had a pleasant stay. The room is small but adequate. Very clean and functional. Friendly and helpful receptionist. Had no problem with the noise (it was well damped). Didn’t get a chance to try the breakfast and the bar.
We had an outstanding experience at the Certo restaurant in Zürich. The food was excellent, the service was friendly and the value for money was top-notch! Highly recommended!
Eating right now. Amazing Lasagna. Well done Casa Certo 😍❤️💕
Lovely little italian bistro in the heart of zürich.  Friendly staff and excellent, authentic and seasonal cuisine!
The food here was delicious and the atmosphere was very pleasant. The waiters were particularly friendly and knowledgeable regarding the menu.

Overall nice place (atmosphere, service), however the pasta we had were not good - the sauce of the cacio e pepe had little to do with Italian recipes. Hope they would improve their recipe or change their chef, so that I would come back

Most staff (apart from front desk) is unfortunately quite rude. Also the casino itself has more of a hotel lobby vibe. Toilets were questionably clean at 7pm on a Wednesday, can't imagine how it looks on the weekend or later at night.

The casino is well organized. Friendly staff.there are windows to see the dark of the night :). They give 10 chf coupon and free drinks if you visit the place during the week between 6 to 7. The bar is also very nice with prices that are reasonable. Importantly, the drinks are very well made. I recommend trying this casino … probably not a lot of times ;).
I always considered the Swiss intelligent people. But today I learned they have to pay 10 francs just to enter the casino so you can lose your money. Not so smart after all!
Just a short leisure and little entertainment.

Literally the unfriendliest casino in the whole world . I have played in Europe , Australia , US … and no casino asked poker players to pay entry… imagine coming to play poker for Thousands and don’t even offer freebies .. wt on earth
Won’t go back

Had a reservation for 18:15 specifically for the football, upon arrival the pub was full and after 10 minutes of waiting no one greeted us, also not convinced they were serving food. May be good for walking but don’t bother if you’re expecting to guarantee a table

It is not a place for foreign visitors expecting to have some quiet conversation over a meal. It is for soccer fans in groups to drink, cheer and shout. Ordered “battered fish” on the menu but as it turned out, there were only a few tiny pieces of deep fried fish. Chips quantity adequate.

Visited the place alone to watch the Real madrid vs Manchester city game. The tv’s were not tuned between them, half of them were earlier and other later. The food was very average and nothing special about it. The service was good, but there was only one waiter which I found very unprofessional for such a busy place. He was running up and down all alone trying to please everyone, but the place needed more waiters for sure.

Very busy place with a good food. Despite the very peak hour we've got a pretty good service and we were still able to keep a conversation in a fully crowded room with some effort. Place is very clean, professional and in traditional style.
Can recommend.
Great service!
We had an outstanding experience at the Certo restaurant in Zürich. The food was excellent, the service was friendly and the value for money was top-notch! Highly recommended!
Eating right now. Amazing Lasagna. Well done Casa Certo 😍❤️💕
Lovely little italian bistro in the heart of zürich.  Friendly staff and excellent, authentic and seasonal cuisine!
The food here was delicious and the atmosphere was very pleasant. The waiters were particularly friendly and knowledgeable regarding the menu.

Overall nice place (atmosphere, service), however the pasta we had were not good - the sauce of the cacio e pepe had little to do with Italian recipes. Hope they would improve their recipe or change their chef, so that I would come back

Good food but we've had better indian food before. Daal was amazing and paneer Tikka masala seemed like butter paneer to us and it was alright, wouldn't get it again. The young guy serving us was quite timid could barely hear him unfortunately. Not too talkative either. Would come back and try different dishes.

Restaurant is in decent place. Atmosphere is okay but the food was bad. They served half cooked food. Curry taste was also very mediocre. When we complained about that, the waiter said that is the best they can provide. Felt arrogance. Hopefully, they will take care of cooking and hospitality in future.
One of the best vegetarian Indian restaurants I've visited. Customer service was fantastic. The food was spot on. Very tasty. Highly recommended.

I went to Masala for lunch with a colleague and I was really impressed.
I lived in London for many years where there are many good Indian restaurants so my expectations weren’t too high. That said, I found a really great and attentive customer service, good food, fair prices and most importantly plenty of vegan options.

I would highly recommend Masala and I will definitely go back soon.

Lunch Buffet is very good! Big assortment of plates.
For take away the Vegan-Based Chicken Bombay roll is also very good, spicy & delicious!

Finding the perfect pizza in Zurich has been a journey, especially with my Swiss Italian roots setting the bar high 🍕. But I've finally hit the jackpot at Don Leone! The pizza here is nothing short of fabulous – the dough, a dreamy blend of crispy and chewy, just melts in your mouth. What made our visit even more special was the incredibly kind staff, who made us feel like family from the moment we stepped in. Spending such a fabulous evening with my loved ones, enjoying mouthwatering pizza, was truly unforgettable. If you're in Zurich craving authentic pizza, Don Leone is the place to be! 🌟🍽️

During my recent visit to Don Leone, I was thoroughly impressed with the quality and generous portions of the food. Every dish was excellently prepared, making each bite a delightful experience.

However, the overall experience was marred by the excessive wait times. Even for something as basic as water, we found ourselves waiting unusually long. Additionally, our drink orders were forgotten multiple times, suggesting a potential issue with staff being overwhelmed.

The restaurant itself was packed to the brim, which not only impacted the service but also affected the ambiance. It felt more like a place to leave quickly after eating rather than a spot to linger for additional drinks.

My suggestion would be to consider removing a few tables. This would give the staff more space to move and attend to guests more efficiently. I believe that such a change could positively impact service quality and encourage longer stays by guests, ultimately reflecting in better tips and increased sales.

In summary, Don Leone has the potential to be a top-notch dining destination, provided some adjustments are made to enhance the customer experience.

We had the best service from a gentleman who is originally from Portugal but now has been living in Zurich for the past 24 years (we never got his name). He was personable, friendly, professional and completely made our experience memorable. We have travelled to 3 different countries in the last month and this guy was the best server we encountered. His wine and food recommendations were superb! Thank you Don Leone for an unforgettable time!

Roman style pizza was ok, perhaps a bit too loaded but some people like this. Wide selection of "antipasti" with fresh and tasty ingredients. Long list of different pasta formats and sauces. Did not had Tham but they looked good and tasty.
Prompt and gentle service. The place instead is a bit small and can get stuffed quite easily.
Restrooms are not wheelchair accessible.

Only 3 stars because the place is ok but quite small and the pizzas are good but you can find better in Zürich.

One of the best italian places in Zurich!

Honestly the pizza is amazing, with fresh mozzarella and fresh ingredients, and I strongly recommend their starters, especially the parm crust one :)

They have a selection of ~20-25 pizzas but you can customize them as you wish and the staff is very friendly.

We always come here from time to time for the pizza as it’s absolutely delicious, and it’s the kind of pizza where the crust is really good!

I loved this place.
The food was just amazing. Both starters and Main dish were delicious. It is probably too much food , I had to take away the pad Thai.
Service was also good.
I’ll definitely be back there.

My food was excellent (Chengdu Tji) and the service was good. The other dishes in the table were pretty good as well.

I would have put 4 stars but:
- the "homemade" mango ice-tea was clearly a bottled mango juice mixed with other stuff (however they accepted to take it back and give me a beer instead, which is good)
- the tap water is called "Zurich Wasser" and costs 3 CHF for 0.5l and 5 CHF for 1l
- the hand dryer in the women's bathroom was OOO.

Used to go here quite often before Covid, and found it good, if a little inconsistent. Back for the first time in several years last night and I was really disappointed - the Sichuan beef was the worst Chinese food I’ve had in a long long time - no real flavour, rubbery beef - very disappointing. No complaints about the service though.

Excellent service and food is really good. Had lunch a few times here (never had dinner). There is a noodle weekly basis and lunch item which is very my favorite. One of my favorite restaurants in Zurich.

My third time here. First time with my wife. Nice birthday treat.

I try something different each time and every dish and beverage are so far, excellent. I am especially enjoying their shanghai ice tea.

Homey little place with delicious fondue. Little off the beaten path from downtown area, but we were able to get right in. The fondue was very good and came with plenty of dipping options. Service was attentive. I believe it's only indoor seating. I would go again if in the area

We came right at open for lunch and had the whole place to ourselves. The staff were so incredibly warm and welcoming and looked after us exceptionally well. My wife is both pregnant and has celiac disease (gluten allergy) and they were able to make her an alcohol free version of fondue and gave extra potatoes instead of bread!
The fondue was exceptional - not greasy or anything - the flavour was unbelievable. What an experience. 10/10 would recommend

As a Swiss, I have to say it doesn't get any more authentic than that.

You get a generous amount of bread and they also give you potatoes.

The caquelon heavenly smelled of garlic.

The waitress came by multiple times to check our flame in order to make sure that our fondue wasn't burning.

And yes, the dessert was of course top notch as well!

We tried the one where you get the meringues AND the chocolate mousse.

So if you are looking for an authentic Fondue place in central Zurich, this is the place to go to!
Really good fondue, at decent price. One and a half portion is more than enough for two people. The lady there is very helpful in explaining all you need to know about fondue and how to eat it.

Very Authentic swiss Fondue restaurant, our Fondue experience was super delicious & very satisfying.
Service was great 👌
Cozy venue.
Excellent food, with delicious mezze. I recommend ordering mezze to share and adding some skewers. The wine is also good. It's better to make a reservation before you go.

This restaurant is one of the few Lebanese places abroad that truly offers authentic and delicious Lebanese cuisine. The service was fast, and the manager was super friendly. I definitely recommend it!

An exceptional event space and place for a private event!

It is so atmospheric and intimate and the service and food were outstanding!

They helped me with everything, including booking a Bellydancer!

It was such a unique and warm experience for everyone!

How to say this? Look I’m really not into making bad reviews but I have the feeling that the owner or the manager is needs to wake up! His treatment is so barbaric! Is crazy the frustration this person emanates! White hair small black glasses! Watch out: if you don’t order enough he becomes so angry! I got to say the food is over priced! For the quantity served and the quality of it, not worth it at all.
There are in zurich so many other better places where to eat! Don’t go into this one is really not worth it.

One of the places where you can get halal meat (I think he told us the chicken and meat are halal but the beef isn't) which was nice of him to tell us upfront. Good traditional Lebanese food. Though the service was a bit slow (or maybe we were in a hurry!) but the food was good. Considering we saw at least 4 food delivery riders  come in during our meal, I'd say it's a popular place!

Disappointed with the service. We arrived at 13:20 and they said we could not have fondue chinois anymore because they close at 14:00. Then they said we could have something else, but by the time we were going to sit they decided it was too late to serve us. I would suggest to the restaurant to say in google maps you close at what ever time you can not take any more costumers.
Very sad since we were looking forward to trying it.
Excellent Wiener Schnitzel, friendly waiters, just stop reading and go try this restaurant already !

Fantastic little gem close to main station focused on Austrian dishes.
We had one of the best Wiener Schnitzel there and can definitely recommend it! The portions are really big (we skipped starters because we read about it) and the potatoe salad is a blast.
Prices are above average but for Zurich totally okay.
The service is super friendly and I highly recommend trying it!
What a lovely host! She made us feel very welcome. The food was so delicious. Loved everything!

What a lovely place. Very nicely decorated and the garden terrace is beautiful.
The food was amazing, best Wiener schnitzel you can find in Zurich if not even Switzerland.
The charismatic service did everything to make us feel welcome and he recommended a wonderful wine.
We had such a nice evening there. We will be back for sure!
We had an outstanding experience at the Certo restaurant in Zürich. The food was excellent, the service was friendly and the value for money was top-notch! Highly recommended!
Eating right now. Amazing Lasagna. Well done Casa Certo 😍❤️💕

Won’t go back

Eating right now. Amazing Lasagna. Well done Casa Certo 😍❤️💕

Great hotel within walking distance of the centre but in a nice quiet area. We had a double ensuite which was a nice size. Everything was spotlessly clean. We only had breakfast once but it was good and  plentiful. Staff were great and let us fill up coffee travel mugs on the day we left even though we were not having breakfast. Nice little area where you can get a drink by the side of reception as well. Would definitely stay again.

The perfect price-quality relation for staying in Zurich. We choose a triple bedroom with shared bathroom. When we booked, we were afraid of the cleanliness condition, but we found it always very clean and tidy. We had a wonderful experience in this hotel. Friendly stuff, well located and close to transportation. I will search for it the next time I visit Zurich.

Very noisy, trams on all sides of hotel. Outstanding breakfast. Boxed eggs, warm milks, but all else great. Afternoon bar food was terrible. Cold and dried up, some from day before. Hamburger price (nothing else) was 18E. Nobody eating here because of high prices. Tub and sink drains both not working. Filled both to top, couldn't use after one use. Had to switch rooms after unpacking all.

Overall a great stay. The shared bathrooms are no problem as it is only with one other room. Front desk lady who greeted us most often was very nice and was patient with my poor German skills. However, housekeeping did come into the room once without even knocking first. So that was strange.

During our trip to Zurich with my wife, we stayed in this hotel for two days. The reception was very good. When we arrived, I realized that I had mistakenly reserved a room with a shared bathroom, but the reception changed the room for us at our request. The hotel was located in a great and quiet neighborhood with close access to the tram, shops and restaurants. The rooms were very clean and they had a good breakfast. Thank you for the hospitality of the hotel

Davened minche mariv there. Pleasant place for learning and davening. Could have used a bit more air conditioning but I guess that's Switzerland.

Such a worm community
Good synagogue and mikvah
Just 19 minutes away from the airport
Definitely my favorite Shul/Minyan factory in the EU, very welcoming, like the Schtiebels in BoroPark!!!!!
Very welcoming people. Was there for one shabbat. Recommend if you stay in Zurich.

Thank you for the hospitality of the hotel

Architecturally interesting train station below street level, yet open and bright. Unfortunately, it is often correspondingly drafty. Culinary and shopping offerings at the train station are rather poor.

For me, the Enge and Wipkingen stations are the gems among the Zurich city stations: architecturally interesting, as well as traffic-wise. However, the two Ws offer no consolation for the commuter's heart, more of a service wasteland. But that's why there is narrowness,
Stadelhofen, Oerlikon and also Hardbrücke. But if you want to travel again, you should change trains in Wiedikon. But be careful: Depending on your destination, it is essential to get out of the station in the right place: at the building with the stop of the same name or at Kalkbreite or on the Seebahnstrasse side. This may save two trams! 😂
No lift on the Kalkbreite side, but a lift on the other side at the train station.
Who exactly were these stops built for? Doesn't have a "house". When it rains it is uncomfortable!
Too little going on, I feel lonely...
vegi market early on Tuesday and Thursday morning!

1 minute from my home, great connections in all directions. Tram 8, bus 31.... every Friday and Tuesday market on Saturday flea market and of course for anyone who is looking for a good cheap bike on Saturday the velo exchange on Helvetplatz..... it also has toilets that are free... a great bookstore with great special books and and and
Well, not my area anymore, but when I have an appointment I still have to go here every now and then... but there are much nicer places in Zurich...😉👌

Served by tram number 8 and trolleybus number 32.
Various events take place here.

Great hotel within walking distance of the centre but in a nice quiet area. We had a double ensuite which was a nice size. Everything was spotlessly clean. We only had breakfast once but it was good and  plentiful. Staff were great and let us fill up coffee travel mugs on the day we left even though we were not having breakfast. Nice little area where you can get a drink by the side of reception as well. Would definitely stay again.

The perfect price-quality relation for staying in Zurich. We choose a triple bedroom with shared bathroom. When we booked, we were afraid of the cleanliness condition, but we found it always very clean and tidy. We had a wonderful experience in this hotel. Friendly stuff, well located and close to transportation. I will search for it the next time I visit Zurich.

Very noisy, trams on all sides of hotel. Outstanding breakfast. Boxed eggs, warm milks, but all else great. Afternoon bar food was terrible. Cold and dried up, some from day before. Hamburger price (nothing else) was 18E. Nobody eating here because of high prices. Tub and sink drains both not working. Filled both to top, couldn't use after one use. Had to switch rooms after unpacking all.

Overall a great stay. The shared bathrooms are no problem as it is only with one other room. Front desk lady who greeted us most often was very nice and was patient with my poor German skills. However, housekeeping did come into the room once without even knocking first. So that was strange.

During our trip to Zurich with my wife, we stayed in this hotel for two days. The reception was very good. When we arrived, I realized that I had mistakenly reserved a room with a shared bathroom, but the reception changed the room for us at our request. The hotel was located in a great and quiet neighborhood with close access to the tram, shops and restaurants. The rooms were very clean and they had a good breakfast. Thank you for the hospitality of the hotel

Nice boutique hotel, very nice and accommodating staff, easy to walk to downtown, discounted parking at a nearby garage, clean, simple check in and out, on the river for beautiful strolls. Would definitely recommend, much less expensive than other local hotels, room was a bit small but really doable. Lovely place altogether.

We only needed a room for one night before our flight out,and at $300, this seemed like nice accommodations and better priced than others. First the good, The staff was lovely. Very friendly, especially the bartenders at the pool bar where we had a few drinks in the evening. My issues were first, the room. It definitely didn't look like the pictures that were showed online of bright airy rooms. It was extremely small and bare, just a bed, TV and small desk, the floors were black and the walls dark green so it felt like a dungeon. Just dark and depressing. My second issue...we arrived after a long train ride and wanted coffee. During the course of the day we spent about $25 on coffee at the restaurant and bar. It wasn't until before checkout the next morning that I found a room downstairs that had a complimentary coffee machine. Maybe the staff could have mentioned that? Especially when we're sitting in the very next room paying for it??

While from the outside, this place looks nice and chic, sadly, our visit there was rather a sad affair. We stopped there on Saturday evening for a pre dinner drink, the bar was barely half full, we sat outside and although we had been seen, no one approached us for a good 20 mins. After finally ordering a cocktail and a glass of wine, we waited another 20 mins for it to be served to us, while the bar person was arranging glasses on the bar shelf. Overall, a very poor experience and I doubt we'll be back.

We stayed for two nights here on arrival in Zurich from Australia.  We had previously advised the hotel that our flight was landing early and requested an early check in.   On arrival at the hotel at 9.30am we were absolutely delighted to find that our room was ready.  The room, though small, was clean and had everything we needed.  Staff were very friendly and helpful, lent us an adaptor plug for our chargers (we have several but none that fitted the Swiss version!).    The hotel is very conveniently located - walking distance from the main station or there is a station (Selnau) within 100m of the hotel.  Great location to catch a tram or to walk into the city.   We would definitely stay here again.

Stayed for a one night transit in Zurich. Had a pleasant stay. The room is small but adequate. Very clean and functional. Friendly and helpful receptionist. Had no problem with the noise (it was well damped). Didn’t get a chance to try the breakfast and the bar.
This shul is amazing! Warm, inviting and welcoming! Kind generous Yirei Shomayim!
Davened minche mariv there. Pleasant place for learning and davening. Could have used a bit more air conditioning but I guess that's Switzerland.

Such a worm community
Good synagogue and mikvah
Just 19 minutes away from the airport
Definitely my favorite Shul/Minyan factory in the EU, very welcoming, like the Schtiebels in BoroPark!!!!!
Very welcoming people. Was there for one shabbat. Recommend if you stay in Zurich.
Lovely station, despite the cold feeling to it, the architecture is interesting, while the station has an over line building. The coffee shop is excellent and the kiosk well stocked.
Centrally located train station with short walk to tram and bus. Clean. Idea for improvement: WLAN.
Small train station in the ground and tram / bus stop on the ground in front of the train station. Easy access to trains and buses, good organization and straightforward signs.
As a non German speaker I found the buses super easy to use, not to mention super clean. I really appreciate the maitance and uptake they put into the station!

Sadly, there aren't that many trains stopping at Wiedikon anymore. Most of them are just passing through nowadays. There still are some Service Lines that are traveling with a 15 Minute delay between them, so you can be sure to get one train around the time you are arriving.
Nice and clean train station for trains S4 and S10. It is located under the river so you have to take long deep escalator.
1st train station from Utilberg to Zurichs inner city. There is a little river that flows, its a very beautiful spot. where you can go for a run or take your dog for a walk.
Very well connected station, however has very little/no amenities or Facilities. Really just a 'hop-on, hop-off' station.
The noise from arriving and departing trains is just blinding...

Incredible main station with connection to zurich airport in 10 min every 10 min, connection across Switzerland & Europe. The station with massive with an overwhelming commercial outlets and unmatched central location just few min walking to old town

Clean and quite large, on first visit got lost and hard to navigate as no signs in english especially with regards to the way out or exit, after a few attempts was able to find may way around and was simple really. Lots of shops in the lower floors and trains are frequent and on time. Double decker trains are clean and very smooth ride, no ticket inspectors through our stay but dont let that fool you as fines are hefty should you be caught, used the trains to the choc factory, airport return and a bite to eat too. Trains run from early hours and caught one at 5:16am and came on time, very reliable.
Very clean and  organised
Clean and with good information. Amazing this principal train station.

Station with many destinations.
Also shopping facilities
Good leveled me up in pocemon go!
Good
This i a best
A stop on the VBZ tram, 2.3, and also bus 32. Quite a confusing place where e-bike riders often have "near accidents" with pedestrians. Since it is close to Langstrasse, this stop is often dirty
Great tram stop with a bench and roof, as you can find in abundance in Switzerland. Near Wiedikon train station.
Unfortunately not what I was looking for, I was actually looking for the film about Steve Jobs, but this came up, complete rubbish 1/5 stars
Werd, mainly known because of the Zurich town hall. District 4, various options.
A nice little dip. Ing. Fust branch is directly adjacent to the Werd stop.

The Wiedikon train station was really excellently renovated a few years ago. You can still see what this station must have looked like in its original version. It is also very well connected to public transport.
Wiedikon train station has trams and buses, and also has a post office, restaurant, etc.

Old train station building from (at least) the last century. From you it seems "hollowed out", gray, functional and... a place that you want to leave quickly, quickly. It's great that the S-Bahn, bus and tram stop there.
Well organized!
Bahnhof Wiedikon is a convenient stop for commuter trains with a Café and a newspaper shop. The way it is built across the tracks is unique in Switzerland.
Good connection, easy access with both lift and stairs.
Peaceful train station

An important S-Bahn / VBZ transfer stop.
It has a coffee & a kiosk.
Here all trams and buses run in both directions.
Attention, bus line 67 (final stop Wiedikon station) ends here!
So wait for the bus on the side out of town towards Schmiede Wiedikon / Heuried / Triemli.
There is only a drop-off stop on the “island” opposite. If you stay seated, you risk being stuck in a waiting area next to the train station on the bus.

A well-lit train station in the dark.
Nevertheless, I would prefer to use the HB-Zürich or the Bhf.Enge. (Because of the security).

The postbus stop for most lines, in the same location as the VBZ buses and trams.
At times and under certain circumstances, the post bus also runs to the side of the train station, pay attention to announcements and signs/postings at the stop.

A quiet train station. With a kiosk and the Café Spettacolo. Large foyer for waiting and a lift and stairs to reach the two tracks in the basement. There is also an ATM (Credit Suisse) in the train station (behind the kiosk next to the Selecta machine).   Very cozy. Charming old building.
Lovely station, despite the cold feeling to it, the architecture is interesting, while the station has an over line building. The coffee shop is excellent and the kiosk well stocked.

District building where negotiations take place where decisions are made about what to do next with the plaintiff. There is also a prison in the building.

Unfortunately I can't say anything about the district building as such. However, the tram stop gets a 10/10 straight away. I prefer to go there in the afternoon in April because that's when the sun stays above the station for the longest time. Trash cans on both sides. running.
Tram stop directly at the district building. Tram lines No.2 + No.3 serve this stop.

Thank you for the hospitality of the hotel

Nice boutique hotel, very nice and accommodating staff, easy to walk to downtown, discounted parking at a nearby garage, clean, simple check in and out, on the river for beautiful strolls. Would definitely recommend, much less expensive than other local hotels, room was a bit small but really doable. Lovely place altogether.

We only needed a room for one night before our flight out,and at $300, this seemed like nice accommodations and better priced than others. First the good, The staff was lovely. Very friendly, especially the bartenders at the pool bar where we had a few drinks in the evening. My issues were first, the room. It definitely didn't look like the pictures that were showed online of bright airy rooms. It was extremely small and bare, just a bed, TV and small desk, the floors were black and the walls dark green so it felt like a dungeon. Just dark and depressing. My second issue...we arrived after a long train ride and wanted coffee. During the course of the day we spent about $25 on coffee at the restaurant and bar. It wasn't until before checkout the next morning that I found a room downstairs that had a complimentary coffee machine. Maybe the staff could have mentioned that? Especially when we're sitting in the very next room paying for it??

While from the outside, this place looks nice and chic, sadly, our visit there was rather a sad affair. We stopped there on Saturday evening for a pre dinner drink, the bar was barely half full, we sat outside and although we had been seen, no one approached us for a good 20 mins. After finally ordering a cocktail and a glass of wine, we waited another 20 mins for it to be served to us, while the bar person was arranging glasses on the bar shelf. Overall, a very poor experience and I doubt we'll be back.

We stayed for two nights here on arrival in Zurich from Australia.  We had previously advised the hotel that our flight was landing early and requested an early check in.   On arrival at the hotel at 9.30am we were absolutely delighted to find that our room was ready.  The room, though small, was clean and had everything we needed.  Staff were very friendly and helpful, lent us an adaptor plug for our chargers (we have several but none that fitted the Swiss version!).    The hotel is very conveniently located - walking distance from the main station or there is a station (Selnau) within 100m of the hotel.  Great location to catch a tram or to walk into the city.   We would definitely stay here again.

Stayed for a one night transit in Zurich. Had a pleasant stay. The room is small but adequate. Very clean and functional. Friendly and helpful receptionist. Had no problem with the noise (it was well damped). Didn’t get a chance to try the breakfast and the bar.
This shul is amazing! Warm, inviting and welcoming! Kind generous Yirei Shomayim!
Davened minche mariv there. Pleasant place for learning and davening. Could have used a bit more air conditioning but I guess that's Switzerland.

Such a worm community
Good synagogue and mikvah
Just 19 minutes away from the airport
Definitely my favorite Shul/Minyan factory in the EU, very welcoming, like the Schtiebels in BoroPark!!!!!
Very welcoming people. Was there for one shabbat. Recommend if you stay in Zurich.

Avoid if possible. It is overly expensive, i get overcharged by simple visits, some of the doctors are clueless and overall it is really not worth the money or time. The charges are not always transparrent as they send no analytical bill, only a consolidated one through Swica.

I have found the team at Medbase Wiedikon helpful, efficient and supportive. Although I am learning German, it is good to be able to explain in detail in English. I appreciate this. Also, my efforts in German are met with patience!

I came to treat my iron-defficiency anemia to Medbase Wiedikon, and met Dr. Berrah. I'd just recently arrives in Zurich and was looking for GPs that accept new patiens (highly non-trivial), so I ended up at this clinic almost by accident, but I'm glad I did.

Dr. Berrah is paying every attention needed: compared the treatments, and offered the one that suited me most (injections over supplements, since I have a tendency for stomack issues), recommended me amazing specialists to get checkups and find a cause or at least exclude the most dangerous potential causes. He recommeded me regular check-ups for iron level to not allow it to drop as low as when it was when I just came. I had in total three visits over a year, two of them resulted in recommendation for iron injectoins, which I also made at the same clinic.

Dr. Berrah, all the nurses and reception personnal were kind, friendly, and inviting throughout my visits. I especially appreciated that since I'm new to Switzerland (and it's medical system) and don't speak German

This praxis has degraded so much that it is difficult to describe the experience. Some of the staff is extremely unprofessional, aggressive and unsympathetic. After calling in the morning with strong short breath and chest pain and waiting all day for a call back, I decide to go to get the medication.
The medical assistant at the reception was the worst and should definitely not be attending patients. Unprepared, unprofessional and extremely rude, he screamed at me twice seeing that I was grasping for air.

As a Swica member over years I must always go to Medbase,(Santemed)
Some of their staff are really in their comfort zone. I always had the feeling that I needed to beg to have some wishes fullfilled.
Once I had a huge discussion with a very unfriendly lady at the reception, and I saw same experiences  with other patients too. Is not a charity (people pay for it) and even it was, when we deal with people from several backgrounds we need to be carefull.
The reception team is the most important for a good image, and many times I missed it.

However, recently I was directed to BLANKA JURAS.
She is very precise, young, updated, she finds all the tools to support you and solve your case, delivering a fast service.
If you do not understand specifs medicals topics even if german or english are not your mother tongue, she goes extra miles to help you.
Blanka prepares herself with passion and engagement for each appointment, bringing  alternatives if needed.

Last but not least, I follow the pattern that if you work in the health care sectors you have to sell and offer it by
the way you speak, you walk, and greet your  client . It makes a difference.

And the most important is your body shape. Being Doctor and fat does not match. How can a fat person sell me health?
Before being a patient I am a client, I am paying for the service, how can I trust in an advise of a person who does not follow it? Therefore is very important choosing a very good doctor.
At MEDBASE WIEDIKON, Blanka Juras is the best choice.

Although I have only been training at HT Health Training AG for a short time, I can already only say good things about my training with Dilan Bilen. During the first preliminary discussion and when putting together the training plan, I was positively surprised by the broad knowledge and understanding that Ms. Bilen has about her customers' bodies and minds. Within a very short time, she had constructed the perfect plan for me, which included exactly those points that were important to me in advance. So I was introduced to all the exercises perfectly at my own pace, so that I understood them exactly after just a few attempts.

In addition to the professional, nice but strict manner, all of my questions are answered professionally and I receive exactly the support I need. I can already see progress, which can be attributed to Ms. Bilen's targeted training structure.

I have also found the entire team at HT Health Training AG to be very open-minded, friendly and helpful and I always look forward to going to training. The rooms are well located and you also have a great view over Wiedikon train station and the entire city of Zurich.

The stretching area is tiny in comparison to the number of members that train here. Most of the time the area is occupied and crowded. This studio is the only one from Activ that doesn‘t let you use the empty group fitness room in such situations. Many people do stretching in between the cardio machines on the dirty floor, it is very unhygienic.

Very unfriendly to customers

I've been here now for a while and will not extend my fitness subscription here. The place is lacking quite a few items for a good fitness experience
- Opening hours (open at 9h, close at 18h on some days makes no sense)
- Too warm inside, instantly sweating
- The whole place smells like sweat, no good ventilation/hvac
- Staff doesn't care about people cleaning the machines, so only a few do it (gross)
- Showers are low pressure, and the water is very close to the wall (have to stand against the wall to get wet). Also, it's not that clean.
Absolute worst customer service, facilities and price level I have ever come across in my life. Be sure to meticulously read the T&C before signing any contract.
I wouldn't recommend to make an Annual subscribtion because the Customer Service do not tell you the Conditions. Cancelling is impossible.

It's my favourite club since 2013! And they have great people in the daycare (available from 4 months old to 8 years old) :)
Go, mommy, go❤️‍🔥

I discovered the Booster Transform in August while browsing for a nearby fitness Studio from my work. I tried a session in Studio Forum and I fell in love on how the workout is being done the very first time. I tried the other Studio as well (btw, they are all centrally located) but Studio Forum is my go-to studio. The fact that it is only 15 mins away from where I am working. What really makes this studio special (for me) is it is so quiet not a typical chaos fitness studio because only maximum of 5 participants can do the workout in a session - which kinda a private class feel. In terms of the changing room and shower room. There is a small toilet inside the Studio where you can change but not do the shower. BUT in the opposite room outside the Studio (still same building) there is a big changing room and shower room - boys and girls are separated which the Booster participants are allowed to use. Tip: bring your own lock.

Absolutely humbling experience.
Being a gym rat and priding myself in being able to do any number of crunches/leg raises etc., Damien’s class totally KO’d me today.
I felt very welcomed and it was such a nice atmosphere and environment, and I leave happy, sore and eternally wowed and humbled.
Thank you!

Booster Pilates is the best training i have ever attended in my life. Usually i got bored quite easily with any other kinds of excercises but this one I attend already for almost a year and i am never bored! it is very intensive training stimulating all muscles of your body and you can really see the difference! Trainers are amazing and the atmosphere is very positive. I recommend it very much!

I was obsessed with Booster Transform ever since the first day I tried this work out. Forum studio is centrally located (so are the other two studios), it's their oldest studio but I love how the class is small (only 5 participants per class!) and intimate. Studio is always very clean and organized. Booster wouldn't be as fun of a workout without the amazing, friendly and professional instructors! THANK YOU!

I’ve been attending classes since the first few months Booster Pilates began to change the fitness landscape in Zürich.  A great, challenging workout that strengthens your core as well as your overall fitness.
Try it: you will be addicted!

A great activ fitness studio!

It is one of my favourite gyms in Zurich.

They have separated sauna areas for men and women which makes it possible to go to a woman-only sauna every day.

If you have an Activ Fitness abo, I recommend going into this location.

The staff are friendly and atmosphere is good, however, i primarily go there for the spinning classes which are almost all booked out within an hour of becoming available and the bikes are all either old or broken or both. They invested in some new bikes about a year ago but the majority of these are now also broken. (Adjuster for seat is missing, seat positioning at an angle making it uncomfortable, stabilising pads for the bike missing meaning they wobble when you ride them etc.) It's frustrating to pay an annual fee and then to not be able to attend many classes due to lack of availability and when you do attend to have to put up with old and/or broken equipment.

The people are really helpful and nice with me, even that I'm just a beginner and it's Total new for me. They take care about my special wishes and give some advice. It's clean and fresh. For the people who except more, they can go to a luxurious gym... If you have a problem, you can talk with the manager on site. :)
Machine and equipment are fine but staff can be annoying sometimes and don't take you seriously :/
Old equipment. Spinning classes with these old and malfunctioning bikes is not worth the money for the membership

Unfortunately I have mixed feelings about this place. I did not think that the studio was particularly clean and tidy.

More importantly though I didn’t think they were correct. My trainer was very kind and friendly. I had booked for 1 hour session. She did not keep track of the time (neither did I) and in the end she found out she did 90 minutes. So she decided that I must pay for 90 minutes which she also charged. I did not argue with her at that moment (which I now regret). As a trainer it is her responsibility to keep track of the time and be disciplined, I am the customer.

I left with a bitter feeling and I cannot recommend.
Simply the best!
Excellent trainers and environment
Very friendly and professional studio
Very good training and instructions for Girotonic

data.name: Naam Yoga Zürich @ Gobinde Yoga Studio Kreis 4

reviews.text: Gobinde offers authentic Kundalini classes with fantastic teachers that understand the art of teaching touched with gentleness, wisdom and loving kindness. It's my most favorite yoga studio in town.
I had a great class with Naemi! Don't let the soft start fool you, there will be enough time to sweat depending on the variations you choose.
Great place, strong energy and atmosphere!
Friendly team and nice place

I took Denise's yoga class for pregnant women. I can fully recommend the course to all pregnant mothers! Every yoga class was incredibly fun. I felt like I was in good hands, thanks to Denise's courteous and warm manner! Denise is a great yoga teacher and responds very openly to requests and suggestions. The meditations and breathing exercises suggested in the course are also great preparation for the upcoming birth!
Always the best yoga for years...
Highly Recommended. ♥

Thank you for the hospitality of the hotel

We only had breakfast once but it was good and  plentiful. Staff were great and let us fill up coffee travel mugs on the day we left even though we were not having breakfast. Nice little area where you can get a drink by the side of reception as well. Would definitely stay again.

The perfect price-quality relation for staying in Zurich. We choose a triple bedroom with shared bathroom. Friendly stuff, well located and close to transportation. I will search for it the next time I visit Zurich.

Very noisy, trams on all sides of hotel. Outstanding breakfast. Boxed eggs, warm milks, but all else great. Afternoon bar food was terrible. Cold and dried up, some from day before. Hamburger price (nothing else) was 18E. Nobody eating here because of high prices. Tub and sink drains both not working. Filled both to top, couldn't use after one use. Had to switch rooms after unpacking all.

Nice boutique hotel, very nice and accommodating staff, easy to walk to downtown, discounted parking at a nearby garage, clean, simple check in and out, on the river for beautiful strolls. Would definitely recommend, much less expensive than other local hotels, room was a bit small but really doable. Lovely place altogether.

We only needed a room for one night before our flight out,and at $300, this seemed like nice accommodations and better priced than others. First the good, The staff was lovely. Very friendly, especially the bartenders at the pool bar where we had a few drinks in the evening. My issues were first, the room. It definitely didn't look like the pictures that were showed online of bright airy rooms. It was extremely small and bare, just a bed, TV and small desk, the floors were black and the walls dark green so it felt like a dungeon. Just dark and depressing. My second issue...we arrived after a long train ride and wanted coffee. During the course of the day we spent about $25 on coffee at the restaurant and bar. It wasn't until before checkout the next morning that I found a room downstairs that had a complimentary coffee machine. Maybe the staff could have mentioned that? Especially when we're sitting in the very next room paying for it??

While from the outside, this place looks nice and chic, sadly, our visit there was rather a sad affair. We stopped there on Saturday evening for a pre dinner drink, the bar was barely half full, we sat outside and although we had been seen, no one approached us for a good 20 mins. After finally ordering a cocktail and a glass of wine, we waited another 20 mins for it to be served to us, while the bar person was arranging glasses on the bar shelf. Overall, a very poor experience and I doubt we'll be back.

We stayed for two nights here on arrival in Zurich from Australia.  We had previously advised the hotel that our flight was landing early and requested an early check in.   On arrival at the hotel at 9.30am we were absolutely delighted to find that our room was ready.  The room, though small, was clean and had everything we needed.  Staff were very friendly and helpful, lent us an adaptor plug for our chargers (we have several but none that fitted the Swiss version!).    The hotel is very conveniently located - walking distance from the main station or there is a station (Selnau) within 100m of the hotel.  Great location to catch a tram or to walk into the city.   We would definitely stay here again.

Stayed for a one night transit in Zurich. Had a pleasant stay. The room is small but adequate. Very clean and functional. Friendly and helpful receptionist. Had no problem with the noise (it was well damped). Didn’t get a chance to try the breakfast and the bar.

Do not find much discounts but higher discounts on big bag of chocolates. Over all good experience.

Very cheap but the quality is not great. The variety is good but there are not many healthy, vegetarian/vegan options. They have a lot of alcohol though, also for a rather cheap price.
It is also good for buying things in bulk (mainly snacks and drinks).
Service is great and a large variety of brand name products
This place works fine, but it's just too cramped. You can't almost pass each other when going opposite way between the isles. But otherwise .. they've got stuff I need, so it's ok.
Good prices for Switzerland. Well set out store. Own brand chocolate is excellent.

Coop in Zurich impresses from the moment you step in on the ground floor, with its wide selection of snacks and beverages. The real treasure lies downstairs, accessed via escalator, where a variety of fresh produce, quality meats, and freshly baked bread await. The store’s layout is shopper-friendly, offering a seamless experience. With its commitment to organic and local products, alongside helpful staff, Coop stands out as a top choice for groceries in Zurich. A must-visit for efficient and enjoyable shopping.

It's common that they are cheating on prices out there. Discounts visible on yellow shelf labels are often invalid at the counter. When pointing it out, they can't find the explanation and they refuse to validate it.

I bought too good to go here and I was very satisfied with it. I even had some choice in what they gave me and the overall sum was definitely more than expected! The food was delicious and the collection very quick.
Always neat and tidy. It is divided into two floors and there is no checkout counter in the basement, so it is recommended to go up to the ground after seeing the basement first.

Great local supermarket. Two floors of products, and their own bakery integrated in the -1. The staff is always friendly and helpful, you can also use the self-scanners or the self-checkouts. It’s a really nice place for groceries for the whole neighbourhood.
Very friendly, great opening hours but yeah, its a coop pronto so you will only find a bit of the main take-away things..
Ok place it has croissants,cereal bars, chewing gum, packaged food and just a very good place if u are hungry and in a rush
Small....but has the essentials...
Good product

The STAFF is a disaster!! One of them in particular is constantly confrontational!

As always, Coop (pronto) is of course not interested, customer service at COOP is also a disaster. The umbrella company should take a closer look at such franchisees.
Wonderful service. A pleasure to shop. Clean. Bought kosher alpine cheese.
Best supermarket to stock up for Alps trips! Lots of high-quality European kosher products.
Nice kosher shopping mall. Good foods and drinks and big variety of food. Also has good wine.
Easy 5 stars, Kosher, clean and excellent service. As a side note they have an excellent Pesach variety!!!

Good to see Indian grocery store in Zurich. Luckily our hotel was very near to this place. They have all Indian stuff including lime and thumbs up and haldiraam

Absolutely perfect Indian grocery store in Switzerland. They have a lot of Indian vegetables, masala and pulses. But most of it is aligned to North India and lesser to South India.
Nonetheless, the most important thing is that everything is fresh (atleast for once we don't need to constantly check expiry dates) and staff are very friendly.
They have a small food counter as well which has very good Indian food at very reasonable prices. Prices are atleast 25% lesser than Indian restaurants in Switzerland even some having food that is very bad.

Have added some pictures of unique items we found at the store like mixer grinder, cooker, idly maker, etc.

Finally, getting to the store is quite easy even if you are coming from any other city. Get down at Zurich HB and take a quick tram and a 5 mins walk.

Hope this helps.
Nice to find an Indian grocery store with full set of Indian goods. Very friendly staff.
This place has got all Indian grocery products . Some of Indian vegetables and sea food as well .  Sweets and savoury . Do visit if you looking out for Indian groceries in Zurich
Cool Indian supermarket. Very spacious and clean unlike most Indian supermarkets in Europe I have visited. Very polite service ..always with a smile.

Good Chinese supermarket in Zurich. They have a decent assortment. I'm checking out different asian stores in Zurich to find the one with the most selections and this was not bad. It was my first time in this asian shop and what I like the most is that the staff are friendly and nice. They were helpful with all of my questions and even let me use their toilet. It was a positive experience and I could recommend it.
Good variety of Asian food. The fresh product selection is quite good!

Good mix of spices, frozen foods, some fresh and a wide range of sweet and savory snacks. And they have pre-made bubble tea!? Overall, the best Chinese supermarket I've found in Zürich so far. There is also a range of cooking and serving things too, if you are preparing a banquet.
Limited parking is available in the back streets opposite, and it is close to public transport.

Ohhh this place makes me homesick! Many original goods from Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore that I used to see every single day. These are some selections of herbs that we often incorporate in Chinese traditional medicine, and even dedicated cooker for them. To buy rice, I would prefer coming here. The taste of Taiwanese and Japanese has been recognised as top, if not the best, of the world. Their texture is also better than, say, Thai or Indian rice, in terms of stickiness and firmness. Definitely the top option if you are to make sushi or onigiri (rice ball).
Nice shop. I always like the dumplings we buy there. We also discovered vapor cooking due to this shop.

Love going to Coop, so seeing a mini version of it - "Pronto" - was quite the treat. Was able to get toothpaste and apple juice from this store. The employees are friendly and engaging. Organized and clean store.

The Coop Pronto Shop at Stauffacher is a convenient stop for anyone looking to grab a quick bite to eat or pick up some essentials. I recently visited the shop and was impressed with the range of products and the overall atmosphere.

The shop is clean and well-organized, with clear signage making it easy to find what you need. The staff were friendly and helpful, and I was able to quickly locate the items I was looking for. There is a great selection of fresh produce, as well as a range of packaged foods, snacks, and drinks.

What I really appreciated about the Coop Pronto Shop at Stauffacher was the variety of meal options available. They offer a range of freshly made sandwiches, salads, and wraps, as well as hot food items such as pizza and pasta. The quality of the food was excellent, and I was impressed with the freshness of the ingredients.

The shop also offers a range of bakery items, including fresh bread, pastries, and cakes. There is also a good selection of beverages, including soft drinks, juices, and coffee.

Overall, the Coop Pronto Shop at Stauffacher is a great option for anyone looking for a convenient and quick meal or to pick up some essentials. The quality of the food and the variety of options make it a top choice, and the friendly staff and clean atmosphere only add to the overall positive experience. I highly recommend stopping by the Coop Pronto Shop if you're in the area!
We all wait for Coop at Stauffacher to open the doors for all locals. Coop Pronto serves us in the meantime, though expensive.

I find the website really useful and I encourage potential students looking for an International Business University to check out UIBS, their programs, as well as their cross-cultural  system of excellence education.

I'm currently studying here and doing my Bachelor degree in Business Administration. It's a quite challenging degree. Its a nice environment with loads of international students ranging from the US to Russians to Indians and also swiss locals.If you're looking for a good Business school in Zurich area i would recommend this one, it's fully teached in english. Lex Fridman.text: Nestled in the heart of Zürich, this vibrant neighborhood exudes a lively and bustling atmosphere, catering to its diverse community of over 20,000 residents. With a plethora of dining options and cozy bars like Certo just a short stroll away, socializing and unwinding are effortless here. The convenience of essential amenities like schools, supermarkets, and public transportation within a few minutes' walk adds a touch of practicality to the neighborhood's dynamic vibe.

Real estate agent.text: Nestled in a vibrant neighborhood of about 20,076 residents, this area exudes a lively and bustling atmosphere. With a variety of amenities within a 10-minute walk, including cozy bars, diverse restaurants, and convenient grocery stores, residents here enjoy a dynamic social scene and easy access to daily necessities. The neighborhood's focus on education and fitness is evident through its numerous schools, kindergartens, gyms, and public transportation options, creating a well-rounded and active community vibe.

neutral without emphasis.text: The neighborhood exudes a bustling yet relaxed ambiance, with a diverse array of amenities within easy reach. Residents can enjoy a variety of dining options, fitness facilities, and convenient access to public transportation. The presence of schools and a kindergarten adds a family-friendly touch to the area.
